page.title: 08Annual Events in Banbury
page.content: The Carnival is held in June or July. The big floats parade through Banbury. It starts at Castle Street Car Park, goes round to the Cross and back again. Then there are amusements in the field behind Spiceball. This year there were helicopter rides. The pram race is around Easter. It starts in the market place and goes round the streets and back to the start. On the Sunday nearest St. George's Day the cubs, scouts, brownies and guides all parade with different bands from Castle Street up High Street, round the cross to St. Mary's. In October the fair comes for three nights and fills the bus station, the market place and the streets around. Also there is a Mayor-making ceremony at the town hall every Spring.
